intro: Bucinellina paramicola, commonly known as the Pacific sea snail, is a species of small gastropod mollusk belonging to the family Turbinellidae. It is characterized by its elongated, conical shell that is typically light-colored with a smooth surface. This species is primarily found in the intertidal zones of the Pacific coast, where it thrives in sandy or muddy substrates. The shell of Bucinellina paramicola serves as both a protective structure and a means of camouflage in its marine environment. Due to its habitat preferences, it plays a role in the ecological balance of coastal ecosystems.
